alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Grant; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 4:53PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Clark, southwestern Grant, northern Dallas and southeastern Hot Spring Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Sparkman, or 13 miles southeast of Arkadelphia, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leola... Sparkman... Carthage... Poyen... Richwoods... Thiel... Jenkins Ferry State Park... Dogwood... Gum Springs in Clark County... Lono... Tulip... Manning... Joan... Willow... Brush Creek... Dalark... Griffithtown... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
